messages: d2e8692b78173d96bec003e02d0c196a (18:58): im trying to redirect the web service of other machine to a port in my machine

3eb298b1e9127212aa8a1d60a783f820 (19:02): anyone see anything wrong with this: iptables -I INPUT 1 -i eth0 -p tcp --dport ssh -m mac --mac-source ! 00-13-A4-4C-9R-FD -j DROP
3eb298b1e9127212aa8a1d60a783f820 (19:02): im locking ssh down to enable access only from the specified MAC address
3eb298b1e9127212aa8a1d60a783f820 (19:06): AleXerTecH, im trying to open your link

d2e8692b78173d96bec003e02d0c196a (19:11): im trying to redirect the web service of the machine 192.168.2.6 to the port 7880 of my machine
d2e8692b78173d96bec003e02d0c196a (19:12): for when i go to the browser and put 192.168.2.10:7880 (my machine) this go to the webserver on 192.168.2.6:80
93dede99112199d049a1bc421e564cd4 (19:14): Strykar: looks ok if you only want ssh accessible from your subnet
93dede99112199d049a1bc421e564cd4 (19:20): AleXerTecH: then using MASQUERADE target is unnecessary overhead
93dede99112199d049a1bc421e564cd4 (19:23): AleXerTecH: so all you want iptables for is the forwarding of this one rule on your LAN?
d2e8692b78173d96bec003e02d0c196a (19:24): vice-versa, i want the service web service of the other machine comming out in my machine in the port 7880
d2e8692b78173d96bec003e02d0c196a (19:24): the if i get this working, im going to make the firewall
93dede99112199d049a1bc421e564cd4 (19:26): AleXerTecH: oh ok, I was gonna say this seems like overkill to me to use iptables for just this
d2e8692b78173d96bec003e02d0c196a (19:27): vice-versa, like i toldyou, if this works im going to write the rules for the firewall, and also for the local vpn
d2e8692b78173d96bec003e02d0c196a (19:27): vice-versa, but first i need this working
93dede99112199d049a1bc421e564cd4 (19:27): yes yes, I understood it the first time :)
d2e8692b78173d96bec003e02d0c196a (19:28): so, why this doesnt work :( ?
